Description: Pottery shabti with red painted details: a lappet-wig, a modelled face, a collar, crossed arms in relief holding two hoes, the front of the leg section is inscribed with a column of red painted Hieroglyphs(illegible); the back is decorated with a representation of a yoke with two pendular nw-pots and a seed-basket.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
